image.altText: An older man in a checked shirt and vest sits on a bench outside an old Australian cinema.

props.synopsis: His family announced his death on Thursday afternoon, saying he died peacefully in hospital near his home in the Blue Mountains.

title.children: 'Giant in his field': Legendary film critic David Stratton dead at 85

image.altText: A close up a UTS logo on a large building's windows

props.synopsis: The University of Technology Sydney is suspending more than 100 courses as it prepares for a controversial redundancy program to save $100 million.

title.children: Uni staff told to 'wash delicates' for stress management as 146 courses suspended

image.altText: Trump spruiks 'very friendly' call with Zelenskyy ahead of meeting with Putin

props.synopsis: Members of a visiting delegation of US Congress members from both sides of politics have stressed the importance of a face-to-face meeting between President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Pro-AUKUS congress members say Albanese must secure Trump sit-down

image.altText: Jim Chalmers walks down a corridor.

props.synopsis: The treasurer has downplayed a leaked document from his department that included possible outcomes of the government's upcoming productivity round table, saying it shouldn't come as a "big surprise" that briefings have been prepared.

title.children: Chalmers defends 'genuine' productivity talks after possible outcomes leaked

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese laugh at a pub in Brisbane

props.synopsis: This week in politics the government abandoned a confusing word and a former foreign minister rejected bullying allegations.

title.children: Julie Bishop stays put and Labor abandons the P-word

image.altText: A crowd of men carry two covered bodies in stretchers past ruined buildings.

props.synopsis: Israel has provided documents it says justify its killing of a high-profile Palestinian journalist in Gaza. But the "trust us" mentality employed by Israeli authorities has long lost its power.

title.children: Israel's 'trust us' mentality loses power as it targets journalists

image.altText: A man with a white shirt and tie walking alongside a woman with a black top.

props.synopsis: Fatal crash pilot Sebastian Robinson has denied lying to police about the cause of the accident under cross-examination in Matt Wright's criminal trial.

title.children: Pilot in 'crosshairs' of fatal chopper crash denies lying to investigators

image.altText: Two men leaning towards each other to chat

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has manipulated or scorned a string of US presidents. Now, the question remains whether Donald Trump is about to cement his place alongside them.

title.children: How Putin has used flattery and deception to 'fool' five US presidents

image.altText: ABC radio caller Andrew Moore.

props.synopsis: Andrew Moore, ABC Sport's chief rugby league caller for the past decade, is recovering in hospital after having surgery following a heart attack.

title.children: ABC radio caller Andrew Moore recovering after surgery following heart attack

image.altText: Xavier Coates of the Storm makes a break to score a try

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers and Melbourne Storm, last year's grand finalists, face off in a top-four NRL clash that could have a big impact on where each team finishes the regular season. Follow live.

title.children: Storm surging after three moments of Coates brilliance against Panthers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Xavier Coates's three moments of brilliance
67' TRY: Marion Seve scores for Melbourne
62' TRY: Panthers strike back to retake lead

image.altText: black and white portrait photo of Paul Kelly, wearing business shirt and folding hands in front of his face

props.synopsis: Almost 30 years since releasing his beloved Christmas anthem, the beloved Australian songwriter has penned a dark comic sequel — the first single from his 30th studio album.

title.children: Paul Kelly releases sequel to How To Make Gravy

image.altText: The entryway to a hospital

props.synopsis: A Newcastle homebirth midwife has been charged with manslaughter over the death of a baby on October 10 last year with police alleging she failed to act upon signs of complications.

title.children: Homebirth midwife charged with manslaughter over baby death

image.altText: Smiling woman, man stand close, woman has dark shoulder-length hair, sleeveless top, man in white shirt, bald, #QandA on wall.

props.synopsis: A Central Coast councillor and her husband are charged with assault over a confrontation about erosion on Wamberal Beach.

title.children: Councillor charged with assault as erosion frustrations boil over

image.altText: A picture of a boy with pink hair holding a yellow shark

props.synopsis: The six-year legal battle, brought by American composer Jonathan Wright, was over the catchy "doo doo doo doo doo doo" hook in the famous children's song.

title.children: South Korea's top court dismisses US composer's Baby Shark plagiarism battle

image.altText: A black and white image of a man sitting indoors smiling in a black puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: The former boss of Genius Childcare, which owes creditors millions of dollars, has pleaded guilty to dealing with proceeds of crime.

title.children: Former childcare boss pleads guilty to dealing with suspected proceeds of crime

image.altText: Hail lying on the ground in the street with the sun setting in the background.

props.synopsis: A hailstorm that left Grafton looking like it had been dumped with snow is the latest unusual weather to hit the north of the state.

title.children: Damaging hailstorm follows unprecedented snow in wild NSW winter

image.altText: Rawson Kirkhope, who has dark brown hair and blue eyes, poses for a photo in a black t-shirt, his arms folded

props.synopsis: For years Rawson Kirkhope tried to outrun his trauma, self-medicating with booze, soaking in the toxic cultures of football and the navy. Now he's turning a struggle he was ashamed of into a recovery story he's proud to share.

title.children: Domestic violence and a vicious shooting left Rawson with PTSD and a choice

image.altText: A man takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: More than 100 people from the Bhutanese community across Western Australia have dropped everything to search for missing student Tashi Dewa in the state's South West.

title.children: Bhutanese community rallies in desperate search for missing student

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: The head of the state's Child Abuse Squad tells an inquiry that offenders are likely to "shop around" and work at childcare centres that do not have strong measures in place to prevent abuse.

title.children: Head of NSW child abuse squad warns of 'red flags' in childcare centres

image.altText: An elderly couple with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: It's been almost two weeks since Gregory Vaughan and Kim Worner left George Town Airport in northern Tasmania for a flight over Bass Strait. The search for them, their pet dog and their light plane is continuing, despite no trace being found.

title.children: Search continues for missing couple and light plane, despite no trace

image.altText: A black and white photos of a young woman with brown hair, close up on her face.

props.synopsis: Police arrest and charge a 67-year-old man over the 1994 murder of 24-year-old Castlemaine woman Samantha Mizzi.

title.children: Police charge 67yo with murder in 1994 Melbourne cold case

image.altText: Aerial view of salmon pens and boat in coastal waterway.

props.synopsis: Environmental groups had previously lodged a reconsideration request over a 2012 decision to allow for the expansion of salmon farming, over concerns for its impact on the endangered Maugean skate.

title.children: Federal government rules in favour of Macquarie Harbour salmon farms

image.altText: People cross the road at an intersection in a busy CBD.

props.synopsis: Employment increased by nearly 25,000 people, driven by 60,000 full-time jobs, and the number of unemployed people also fell in the month.

title.children: Unemployment rate improves as full-time jobs surge

image.altText: Jayson Tatum celebrates a basket in the NBA Finals

props.synopsis: The Boston Celtics are sold to a private equity mogul for an American record $9.31 billion in a major changing of the guard for the NBA.

title.children: NBA approves sale of Boston Celtics for record price

image.altText: A doctor with his arms folded stands in front of a window

props.synopsis: Sources told the ABC an offer for the state's top health job was made and quickly scrapped.

title.children: MP calls for transparency over Qld health head appointment

image.altText: Signage for the ANU.

props.synopsis: The prestige of the Australian National University is fast fading. It must now respond to explosive allegations.

title.children: How one of the world's most prestigious universities fell from grace

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie and hat walking outside court surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: After Ward resigned over a sexual assault conviction, it is expected to be a tight race for the NSW seat, which was decided by less than 700 votes in the last election.

title.children: Contest begins to replace disgraced MP Gareth Ward in seat of Kiama

image.altText: An algal bloom warning sign at Somerton along Adelaide's coast.

props.synopsis: As the latest water testing results reveal rising algal levels along parts of the Adelaide coast, the opposition says Freedom of Information documents show government "buck-passing" marked the early months of the bloom.

title.children: Algal levels rising at Adelaide jetties amid 'buck-passing' claims

image.altText: Taylor Swift poses in a body of water in a glittering silver corset

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift's new album might be called The Life of a Showgirl, but her ability to whip her fans into a frenzy ahead of the announcement has one expert calling her a "marketing mastermind".

title.children: Taylor Swift, the showgirl? Her album launch has her labelled a 'marketing mastermind'

image.altText: An elderly woman smiles wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: A NSW coroner finds Forster Private Hospital's care of Margaret Mariani, 88, was "significantly deficient".

title.children: Grandmother's death at private NSW hospital 'preventable', coroner finds

image.altText: A golden mole in red desert sands eating a gecko.

props.synopsis: Many marsupials have become Aussie icons, such as kangaroos, koalas and wombats, yet we still need to pay more attention to this amazing group of animals, experts argue.

title.children: Once dismissed as 'low mammals', marsupials are Australian survivors

image.altText: Collage of acts playing Adelaide's Harvest Rock 2025 lineup.

props.synopsis: Back after a rough year off, the two-day festival sees The Strokes, Jelly Roll and The War On Drugs mix it up with a host of impressive homegrown acts.

title.children: Adelaide's Harvest Rock festival revived with bumper 2025 line-up
